intro: Stylidium dispermum, commonly known as the two-seeded triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers. The plant has a unique mechanism for seed dispersal, with its spurred petals acting as a trigger to release seeds when touched. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Stylidium dispermum is a small herbaceous plant that thrives in full sun and is often found in coastal and inland areas of southern Australia.
